channel.title: Paypal - The hidden truth
channel.description:
[size=14pt][u][b]Paypal - The hidden truth.[/b][/u][/size] [i]This is what I read about Paypal[/i]
They wait until you have much money on your account, and then just completely kick you out with the excuse "Your website and transactions seem like fraud, we cannot take this risk. The money will stay on the account in case of charge-backs.". If you receive much payments but withdraw them to your bank account all the time, they will "limit" your account. You will be able to receive money, but not send or spend. Their excuse will be something like "We need more information about you, and your business. Please call, e-mail or fax.". Calling: You will be forwarded to a department that deals with such things. But none of the employees in the department has the powers to help you any further. Total phone costs of me was around 120 euros, I know, that's terrible. Faxing: They will just throw it on a desk and stare until you call them 3 times. E-mailing: They have never answered to any of my e-mails, but waited until I called them. According to the webz, they do not want to answer e-mails because it doesn't make any money. Once your account has enough money because it was limited, they will kick you out completely with the excuse "Your website and transactions seem like fraud, we cannot take this risk. The money will stay on the account in case of charge-backs.". Mail, fax or call whatever you want, you will not get any further.
[i]Want further proof? Check here. [u][b]http://www.paypalsucks.com/[/b][/u] Your account is locked for 180 days![/i] Reply with your thoughts & concerns.

item.title: Paypal - The hidden truth
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

If they didn’t have a legal reason to shut down your account (profit from an illegal private server IS a legal reason) they would NOT be able to do it. So stop thinking that they screwed you over, they are a major company and would not risk doing that for a few hundred thousand dollars a year.

they can shut down accounts for any reason they want, and they will return the money 90 days after account closer - fees chargebacks

Read full topic
